timeline.bodyText:
I'm not quite sure I understand this. isMissingNode() is the case where a property has the JSON value null.
If you were conflating null with the empty string, I could understand, but I think you're trying to say that the string containing two double quotes is the same as the empty string  and the same as null. I don't understand why that is necessarily true. Remember, you're changing this for all JsonNodes in an STS, so while it might be true for the value of a toleration, it might not be true elsewhere.
timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText:
The Kafka configuration mentioned above produces a STS like this
      tolerations:
      - effect: NoSchedule
        key: kafkarole
        operator: Equal

note that value is missing and thus it is null although it is set to empty value in the Kafka CR.
I think it is kubernetes thing removing a property with no value.
replies.author: sknot-rh

replies.bodyText: So why is the .replace("\"", "") necessary then?
replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: If we set value: '' it is propagated as "", in Java string it is "\"\"" which is not equal to "" (empty string).
replies.author: sknot-rh

replies.bodyText: Per https://yaml.org/spec/1.2/spec.html#id2760844 YAML supports quoted scalars (using both " and '). So if value: '' results in the operator seeing the String with contents "" I think that must be a bug somewhere (Jackson?).

timeline.bodyText: Think about the parameter order. Why is it sensible to put tolerations first and tolerationList last, when they're to do with the same thing (the former is describing the path at which we found the latter). They belong next to each other, imho.
timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: I wanted to couple String parameters which are used one right after the another one.
replies.author: sknot-rh

replies.bodyText: When writing a method signature you should usually prioritise how it will look to the caller. The caller doesn't know (or care) in what order the parameters will be used. They just have some arguments, and it makes much more sense to them to pass the path and the value got from that path together.
